content.question: Three long wires, each with currents of the same magnitude, are arranged so that they are equidistant from each other, and in a cross-sectional view they form an equilateral triangle as shown above. Two of the wires, <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, have currents directed into the page, and wire <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has a current directed out of the page. Which of the following best represents the direction of the net magnetic field at point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> that is directly below wire <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and to the left of wire <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents an arrow that points vertically upward.
The figure presents an arrow that points downward and to the right.
The figure presents an arrow that points vertically downward.
The figure presents an arrow that points horizontally to the left.
The figure presents an arrow that points up and to the left.

content.answer: The figure presents an arrow that points up and to the left.
